title: Afgras
description: AFGRAS is a sport organization that is primarily interested in Grassroot sport in Nigeria. They aim to become the No.1 Sport database for collecting sporting records in Nigeria. It caters for almost all sports in Nigeria and want to ensure that it collects all neccesary information from sport stakeholders in the country.

featuredImage.caption: Featured image showing a mockup of some part of the Landing page

problem.description: AFGRAS aims to collect all the record of all sport stakeholders in the country (Atheletes, Coaches, Fans, Medics, etc). The challenge is to create a system where all these people can come and register and have their information verified so it can be used in the future in the case of planning events or to pass information concerning upcoming activities.

processes.title: Identifying areas that need more attention
list: The Landing page needed to show that what the website truly was about
Since there are a lot of forms, I created a clean and reusable form styles
Forms for collecting Stakeholders information were well structured
Record management was needed to be made easier to track users
Make people aware at first glance what AFGRAS is about

processes.title: User Testing
processes.description: After the Initial design process was completed, we ran some testing based on the prototype and made minor iterations were neccesary. This process didn't take long and the UI design was approved and ready for developement

processes.title: Converting UI to code
processes.description: The completed Design was then used to start the development process. I made use of Vue.Js, Bootstrap and SASS to build the frontend of the web application. I started out with customizing bootstrap to ensure I set most of the bootstrap defaults to match the style guide of AFGRAS. With this it was easier to flow faster in converting all the screens designed into code. The use of components in Vue.js also ensured a smoother flow in the development process.
